question: Which two countries share the location of the landscape "Danube–Tisza Interfluve"?
explanation: Hungary and Slovakia are the two countries that share the location of the landscape "Danube–Tisza Interfluve". Danube–Tisza Interfluve is the landscape in Hungarian territory (Hungary and Serbia) in the Pannonian Basin between the Danube and Tisza rivers, east of Transdanubia. It covers a large part of the Great Hungarian Plain.
